Note:
See Walther (1969)
XWalther, Hans. Initia carmina ac versuum medii aevi posterioris latinorum. Göttingen, 1959; 2nd ed. 1969, no.2350, no.8487; Walther (1963)
XWalther, Hans. Proverbia sententiaque latinitatis medii aevi. 6 vols. Göttingen, 1963-69, no.11224a, and cf. 6825, in which they appear
_description: On the Host (6 lines, aaaabb), a tag in the Fasciculus Morum translating a Latin divisio of six physical qualities of the Host

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Round in þe schapyngþenne in þe bakyngWhite in
                    þe seyngSwete in þe smakkyngOn þon (sic) half
                    weel y writeon þat oþer half smethe y smete

Bod187.Transcription:
Rownde in shapynge þynne yn bakyng …In on syde wel y
                    wrete In þat oþer syde smeþe y smote

Bod410.Transcription:
Round in þe shapyngthynne in the bakyng…On þe on
                    half wel I wryteOn þe other half smeth y smyte

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Ronde in schapyngÞynne in þe bakyngWhyte in þe
                    seyngSwete in þe smackyng or tastingOn þe to halfe wel y
                    wreteOn þe toþer halfe þynne ysmete
BodRawC670.Editions:
Foster,  Frances Allen,
                        ed.  
             “Some English Words from the Fasciculus Morum.” 
             Essays and Studies in Honor of Carleton Brown.
            Percy Waldron Long, ed. 
         New York: NYU Press; London: Humphrey Milford, Oxford University Pres,
            1940: 149-57: 156.
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 182.

CamGon71.Transcription:
Rownd in þe schappyngthynne in þe bakyngWhytt in
                    þe seyngSwet in þe smellyngOn þe ton half wel
                    wrytenOn þe toþer smeth smyten

EDU82.First Lines: Rownde in shappyngThyn in the bakyng…
EDU82.Last Lines:
…On that halfe smethe I smyteAnd on that other halfe well I
                    wryte

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Rond in þe schapyngþyn in þe bakyngWyte in
                    þe seyngSwet in þe smakyngOn þat half wol y
                    wryteOn þe top half smeþ y smyte

Spalding.First Lines:
Rounde in shapyngthyn in [ ] makyngWhyte in semyngSwete
                    in tastyngon the to halfe wrytenon the other halfe smyten

WorcF19.First Lines:
Rounde in þe schapyngthin in þe
                    bakyng…
WorcF19.Last Lines:
…on on half wel wryteon þe othure alf smeth y
                    smith
WorcF19.Editions:
Wilson,  J. M. 
             “Worcester Cathedral Library, from the Report of the Librarian, Canon J.
                M. Wilson.” 
             The Library
         4th ser. 2 (1921-22): 257-65: 264.
